intro: Ceranthera, commonly known as the orchid vine, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and the presence of showy, often fragrant flowers. The plants typically have long, thin stems and are found in tropical and subtropical regions. Ceranthera species are known for their complex, spurred petals and their ability to thrive in shaded environments. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
